qas.question: Who did a US drone kill in Sep 2009?
What group did Ilyas Kashmiri lead?
After 2009, who began fighting in Waziristan?
What group did Al-Badar Mujahideen break away from?
What did Al-Badar Mujahideen call for in 2012?

answers.text: mobilisation of resources for continuation of jihad in Kashmir

qas.question: Who ordered the SUS Drone strike in September 2009?
What group was Bruce Riedel the leader of?
What faction broke away from Al-Badar Mujahideen?
How long was Waziristan the new battlefield?
When did terror groups call to end the jihad in Kashmir?

context: In September 2009, a U.S. Drone strike reportedly killed <a0_0><b5_0>Ilyas Kashmiri<b5_0/><a0_0/>, who was the chief of <a1_0><b6_0>Harkat-ul-Jihad al-Islami<b6_0/><a1_0/>, a Kashmiri militant group associated with Al-Qaeda. Kashmiri was described by Bruce Riedel as a 'prominent' Al-Qaeda member, while others described him as the head of military operations for Al-Qaeda. Waziristan had now become the new battlefield for <a2_0>Kashmiri militants<a2_0/>, who were now fighting NATO in support of Al-Qaeda. On <b9_0>8 July 2012<b9_0/>, Al-Badar Mujahideen, a breakaway faction of Kashmir centric terror group <a3_0><b7_0>Hizbul Mujahideen<b7_0/><a3_0/>, on conclusion of their <b8_0>two-day<b8_0/> Shuhada Conference called for <a4_0>mobilisation of resources for continuation of jihad in Kashmir<a4_0/>.
